episodeTitle: Nami is Sick? Beyond the Snow that Falls on the Ocean!
description: Nami collapses from a mysterious high fever as the Straw Hats sail away from Little Garden. Vivi explains the severity of her condition, and the crew realizes they desperately need to find a doctor. Meanwhile, snow mysteriously begins falling over the ocean, and Mr. 2 Bon Kurei is dispatched to Little Garden.

events.title: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei's First Appearance
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei (Bentham) makes his debut as he is dispatched by Baroque Works to Little Garden. He is introduced as a flamboyant okama wearing ballet-themed clothing with a swan motif.
events.significance: Introduction of one of the most beloved characters in One Piece, who will play a crucial role in the Alabasta Arc and later become a close ally of the Straw Hats.

events.title: Mr. 2's Mission to Little Garden
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei is sent to Little Garden to eliminate Mr. 3 for his failure and false report. However, by the time he arrives, Mr. 3 is already gone.
events.significance: Shows the ruthless nature of Baroque Works and how Crocodile deals with failure. This also explains why Mr. 3 went into hiding.

events.title: Chess's First Appearance
events.description: Chess, the head of staff and minister of defense under King Wapol of Drum Island, makes his first appearance in the episode, though he is not formally introduced yet.
events.significance: Introduction of one of the antagonists of the Drum Island Arc who will oppose the Straw Hats.

events.title: Akumai's First Appearance
events.description: Akumai, a Billions agent who serves under Mr. 2 Bon Kurei, makes his first appearance accompanying his superior.
events.significance: Introduction of Mr. 2's loyal follower who will appear throughout the Alabasta Arc.

events.title: Giants' Century-Long Duel Flashback
events.description: The episode includes flashbacks to Little Garden, showing the giants Dorry and Brogy's century-long duel and their backstory.
events.significance: Provides additional context and emotional depth to the Little Garden Arc that just concluded.

events.title: Nami's First Symptoms of Illness
events.description: Nami begins showing the first symptoms of the Five-Day Disease, including exhaustion and excessive sweating. She asks Vivi to watch the Eternal Pose to Alabasta for her, indicating she's not feeling well.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of a crucial plot development that will lead the crew to Drum Island and eventually to meeting Chopper, the future doctor of the Straw Hat crew.

quotes.text: Vivi, can you watch the Eternal Pose for me? I need to rest for a bit.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami recognizing something is wrong with her health

events.title: Nami Collapses with High Fever
events.description: Nami's condition suddenly worsens dramatically. She collapses with a severe fever of 40°C (104°F), with blushing cheeks and forehead. The crew is shocked and worried as they realize the severity of her illness.
events.significance: This critical moment forces the Straw Hats to urgently seek medical help, setting the entire Drum Island Arc in motion and highlighting the crew's desperate need for a doctor.

quotes.text: A fever of 40 degrees... that almost never happens! This is very serious!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi explaining the severity of Nami's condition to the crew

events.title: Five-Day Disease Explained
events.description: Vivi explains that Nami has contracted the Five-Day Disease, a deadly illness caused by a bite from the prehistoric Kestia tick that inhabits Little Garden. The disease causes extremely high fevers and can kill in five days if left untreated.
events.significance: Reveals the cause of Nami's illness and establishes the urgency of finding a doctor. This also shows how dangerous the prehistoric environment of Little Garden was.

events.title: Sanji and Karoo's Panic
events.description: Sanji and Karoo panic and freak out when they see Nami's severe condition. Sanji, being deeply concerned for Nami's wellbeing, is particularly distressed.
events.significance: Shows the emotional bonds within the crew and Sanji's particular concern for the female crew members.

events.title: Nami Predicts Cyclone Despite Illness
events.description: Despite her severe fever and weakened state, Nami demonstrates her exceptional navigation skills by predicting an atypical wind pattern. She warns the crew about an incoming cyclone.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's incredible talent as a navigator even when severely ill, emphasizing how valuable she is to the crew and foreshadowing her importance.

events.title: Zoro Orders Course Change
events.description: Taking Nami's warning seriously, Zoro orders the crew to change the ship's direction. By following her advice, the pirates successfully avoid the dangerous cyclone.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's trust in Nami's abilities and Zoro's leadership when needed. Also shows the crew working together in crisis.

events.title: Snow Begins Falling on the Ocean
events.description: The crew witnesses an unusual phenomenon as snow mysteriously begins falling over the ocean. This strange weather pattern puzzles the crew members.
events.significance: This supernatural weather event signals the crew's approach to a winter island and builds mystery and atmosphere for the upcoming Drum Island Arc.

events.title: Crew Decides to Find a Doctor
events.description: With Nami's life in danger from the Five-Day Disease, the Straw Hat crew realizes they desperately need to find a doctor. They resolve to seek medical help as quickly as possible.
events.significance: This decision sets the entire Drum Island Arc in motion and will ultimately lead to Tony Tony Chopper joining the crew as their doctor.

events.title: Yuki's First Appearance
events.description: Yuki makes her first appearance in the episode, though details about her role are limited at this point.
events.significance: Introduction of a character who will appear in the Drum Island Arc.

quotes.text: Vivi, can you watch the Eternal Pose for me? I need to rest for a bit.
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: A fever of 40 degrees... that almost never happens! This is very serious!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi explaining the severity of Nami's condition

themes.description: The episode emphasizes that even the strongest adventurers are vulnerable to illness and disease, showing the real dangers of their journey.
themes.symbolism: Nami's sudden illness represents how quickly circumstances can change and how fragile life can be, even for determined pirates.

themes.description: The crew's desperate need for a doctor highlights how important it is to have people with specialized skills on the team.
themes.symbolism: The absence of a doctor on the crew creates a critical vulnerability that must be addressed.

themes.description: Even while severely ill, Nami continues to help the crew with her navigation skills, and the crew trusts her judgment completely.
themes.symbolism: The crew's willingness to follow Nami's advice despite her illness shows their deep trust in each other's abilities.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami's vulnerability is shown as she contracts the Five-Day Disease. Despite her severe condition, she continues to demonstrate her exceptional navigation skills, showing her dedication to the crew.
keyActions: Predicts incoming cyclone despite being sick
Asks Vivi to watch the Eternal Pose
quotes: Vivi, can you watch the Eternal Pose for me? I need to rest for a bit.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi demonstrates her knowledge and maturity by recognizing the severity of Nami's condition and explaining the disease to the crew.
keyActions: Explains the severity of the 40°C fever
Watches the Eternal Pose for Nami
Provides medical context about the illness
quotes: A fever of 40 degrees... that almost never happens! This is very serious!

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei makes his memorable debut, introduced as a flamboyant and unique character within Baroque Works.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on the flashbacks to the giants' duel on Little Garden with additional scenes not present in the manga.
The anime added more extended reactions from Sanji and Karoo panicking about Nami's condition.

trivia.fact: This is the last episode in which Wakana Yamazaki voices Nami. She had been filling in for regular actress Akemi Okamura, who had been on maternity leave since Episode 70. Okamura returns from Episode 79 onwards.
Episode 78 is the first episode of the Drum Island Arc, which is widely considered one of the most emotional arcs in One Piece.

sources.title: Drum Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Five-Day Disease that Nami contracts is caused by the Kestia tick, a prehistoric parasite that only exists on ancient islands like Little Garden.
Mr. 2 Bon Kurei's character design is based on the okama culture in Japan, and he became one of the most beloved characters in the series despite being introduced as an antagonist.
This episode had a TV rating of 15.6% when it aired in Japan, ranking #3 in its timeslot.
